dataset.documentation: CPC Unified Gauge-Based Analysis of Global Daily Precipitation

The "Retrospective version" of the CPC Unified Gauge-Based Analysis of Global Daily Precipitation is a gauge-based analysis of daily precipitation constructed over the global land areas. To this aim quality controlled gauge reports from over 30,000 stations were collected from multiple sources including GTS, COOP, and other national and international agencies, and were then interpolated to create analyzed fields of daily precipitation with consideration of orographic effects (Xie et al. 2007). The daily analysis is constructed on a 0.125 degree lat/lon grid and released on a 0.5 degree lat/lon grid over the global domain for a period from 1979 to 2005 [source Xie, 2010]. See more at: https://climatedataguide.ucar.edu/climate-data/cpc-unified-gauge-based-analysis-global-daily-precipitation#sthash.fkEFvtwn.dpuf

Data downloaded from http://ftp.cpc.ncep.noaa.gov/precip/CPC_UNI_PRCP/GAUGE_GLB/V1.0/ on 21/05/2015 and stored in the User Data Gateway (UDG) of the Santander MetGroup climate services (http://meteo.unican.es/en/dataservices).
Public dataset included in the PUBLIC_DATA group of the User Data Gateway (UDG). Register and accept the data policy to access to this dataset (http://www.meteo.unican.es/udg-wiki).
